Method Detail

makeLayoutManipulator

public MiiLayoutManipulator makeLayoutManipulator()
Gets an instance of MiiLayoutManipulator that is suitable for the end-user to interactively manipulate this layout.

Returns:
the manipulator
See Also:
MiiLayoutManipulator

formatEmptyTarget

public void formatEmptyTarget()
Creates any nodes need to have enough to make the layout recognizable, removes any edges currently existing between the nodes, and then creates edges that correspond to this type of layout.

getNodeBounds

public void getNodeBounds(int index,
                          MiBounds b)
Gets the bounds of the node at the given index which is the outer bounds of the node plus it's cell margins.

Parameters:
index - the index of the node to get the 'cell bounds' of.
b - the (returned) bounds

getPrototypeEdge

See Also:

setEdgeConnectionType

public void setEdgeConnectionType(java.lang.String connectionType)
Sets the type of connection that will be considered an edge in the graph layout. Nodes in the layout may have many connections, some of which should not be considered part of this graph. These connections are differentiated by their connection type.

Parameters:
connectionType - the type of the connections that are edges in this graph layout
See Also:
MiConnection.isType(java.lang.String), MiConnection.getType(), MiConnection.setType(java.lang.String)

getEdgeConnectionType

public java.lang.String getEdgeConnectionType()
Gets the type of connection that will be considered an edge in the graph layout.

See Also:
setEdgeConnectionType(java.lang.String)

makePlaceHolder

public MiPart makePlaceHolder()
Makes an place holder (node) for this layout. The registered prototype place holder is copied to make a new node. If no prototype place holder has been registered then a generic MiPlaceHolder is created.

See Also:
setPrototypePlaceHolder(com.swfm.mica.MiPart), getPrototypePlaceHolder()

makeEdge

public MiConnection makeEdge()
Makes an edge (connection) for this layout. The registered prototype edge is copied to make a new edge. If no prototype edge has been registered then a generic MiConnection is created of the correct connectionType.

See Also:
setPrototypeEdge(com.swfm.mica.MiConnection), getPrototypeEdge(), setEdgeConnectionType(java.lang.String)

insertNeighboringNode

public MiParts insertNeighboringNode(MiPart node,
                                     int index,
                                     int relativeLocation)
Inserts the given node at the given relative location to the node at the given index. Valid relative locations are: Mi_ABOVE Mi_BELOW Mi_TO_RIGHT Mi_TO_LEFT Mi_TOP Mi_BOTTOM Mi_FAR_RIGHT Mi_FAR_LEFT

Parameters:
node - the node to insert
index - the index of the node that the given node will be inserted relative to
relativeLocation - the relative location of the insertion point
Returns:
the list of nodes that were inserted (the given node and any placeholders that may have to be added).

appendNeighboringNode

public MiParts appendNeighboringNode(MiPart node,
                                     int index,
                                     int relativeLocation)
Appends the given node at the given relative location to the node at the given index. Valid relative locations are: Mi_ABOVE Mi_BELOW Mi_TO_RIGHT Mi_TO_LEFT Mi_TOP Mi_BOTTOM Mi_FAR_RIGHT Mi_FAR_LEFT

Parameters:
node - the node to append
index - the index of the node that the given node will be appended relative to
relativeLocation - the relative location of the append point
Returns:
the list of nodes that were appended (the given node and any placeholders that may have to be added).

getNeighboringNode

public int getNeighboringNode(int index,
                              int relativeLocation)
Gets the node at the given relative location to the node at the given index. Valid relative locations are: Mi_ABOVE Mi_BELOW Mi_TO_RIGHT Mi_TO_LEFT Mi_TOP Mi_BOTTOM Mi_FAR_RIGHT Mi_FAR_LEFT

Parameters:
index - the index of the node that the given node will be relative to
relativeLocation - the relative location of the node to get
Returns:
the node or null

deleteNode

public void deleteNode(int index)
Deletes the node at the given index. If the node is not a MiPlaceHolder then it is replaced by one. In any case the node is deleted.

Parameters:
index - the index of the node to delete

removeNode

public void removeNode(int index)
Removes the node at the given index. If the node is not a MiPlaceHolder then it is replaced by one. If the node is a MiPlaceHolder then it is deleted.

Parameters:
index - the index of the node to remove
Returns:
the orientation

isOrientationFixed

public boolean isOrientationFixed()
Gets whether the orientation can be changed.

Returns:
true if the orientation cannot be changed

setOrientation

public void setOrientation(int orientation)
Sets the orientation. Typically the valid values are: Mi_HORIZONTAL Mi_VERTICAL However, the implementation is free to define it's own, custom orientations.

Parameters:
orientation - the orientation

getOrientation

public int getOrientation()
Gets the orientation. Typically the valid values are: Mi_HORIZONTAL Mi_VERTICAL However, the implementation is free to define it's own, custom orientations.

Returns:
the orientation

cycleOrientation

public void cycleOrientation()
Changes to the next supported orientation.
